title: DIGITAL HUMANITIES, KPR Institute Engineering and Technology, Autonomous Engineering Institution, Coimbatore, India
paragraphs: The event aimed to explore the intersection of digital technology and humanities, focusing on new methods, tools and innovations in the study of history, literature, linguistics and cultural studies.
Promoting interdisciplinary collaboration between technology and humanities.
Discussing digital tools and methodologies for humanities research.
Examining case studies where technology enhances cultural understanding.
Digital Text Analysis: Participants learned about text mining, natural language processing, and data visualization

World is transforming everyday. In the rapidly evolving engineering landscape, we have an Increased responsibility to transform the engineering education from traditional curriculum to meet the 21st century skills like Creativity, Critical Thinking, Collaboration and Communication. Through our unique and strategic approach we enable our students to learn beyond and prepare them for life long success.
